items.title: US EPA to Rescind Endangerment Finding for Greenhouse Gas Emissions

content.abstract: EPA will issue final rule rescinding 2009 endangerment finding that CO2 and greenhouse gases endanger public health. EPA claims $1.3T savings; scientists and environmental groups denounce as endangering public health and shifting costs to communities.

items.title: Stanford Miniature Light Trap Breakthrough Could Enable Million-Qubit Quantum Computers

content.abstract: Stanford researchers create miniature optical cavities that efficiently collect light from individual atoms, enabling parallel qubit readout. Arrays with hundreds of cavities demonstrated, potentially supporting million-qubit quantum networks for drug discovery and materials design.

items.title: New START Nuclear Treaty Expires: US-Russia Without Arms Control for First Time in 50 Years

content.abstract: New START nuclear arms treaty between US and Russia expired in February 2026, leaving both countries without bilateral arms control for first time in over 50 years. Raises concerns about unconstrained nuclear arsenal development and strategic instability.

items.title: Global Solar+Wind Capacity to Reach 4,000 GW in 2026, Overtaking Coal+Gas

content.abstract: Global combined capacity of solar and wind energy expected to reach 4,000 GW in 2026, surpassing operating capacity of coal and gas-fired power for the first time. Solar PV accounts for 80% of new additions, with distributed solar contributing 42% of growth.

items.title: Edelman 2026 Trust Barometer: Society Slides from Grievance into Insularity

content.abstract: 2026 Trust Barometer reveals grievance has devolved into insularity. 37% cite growing use of GenAI as affecting trust. 54% of low-income respondents believe they will be left behind by AI. Trust in institutions declining across demographics.

items.title: NIST Awards $3.19M for Quantum, Semiconductor, and Biotech R&D

content.abstract: NIST invests $3.19 million in eight small businesses across seven states via Phase II SBIR grants for 24-month R&D projects in quantum technology, biotechnology, and semiconductors.

items.title: WHO Warns: Humanitarian Health Funding Below 2016 Levels, Only 1/3 of Targets Reached

content.abstract: WHO launches 2026 emergency appeal. Humanitarian health funding fell below 2016 levels in 2025, reaching only one-third of 81 million targeted people. Protracted conflicts, climate change impacts, and infectious disease outbreaks drive increasing demand.

items.title: Deepfake-as-a-Service Explodes: Over 30% of Corporate Impersonation Attacks Now AI-Powered

content.abstract: AI-powered deepfakes involved in over 30% of high-impact corporate impersonation attacks in 2025. Real-time voice cloning enables executive impersonation with seconds of audio. Security leaders report 31% least prepared for deepfake attacks.

items.title: US Wave of State Tech Laws: AI, Privacy, Crypto Protections, Right to Repair Take Effect 2026

content.abstract: Dozens of technology-related laws took effect across US states on Jan 1 2026, with more arriving monthly. New rules cover AI governance, social media protections, data privacy (Indiana, Kentucky, Rhode Island), crypto, and right-to-repair electronics.

items.title: Global Jobs Gap Projected to Reach 408 Million in 2026 Despite Stable Headline Employment

content.abstract: ILO reports global jobs gap projected at 408 million in 2026. Stable headline employment masks stalled progress in job quality and widening inequalities. Health, construction sectors grow while retail, federal government decline.

items.title: Physical AI Reaches Inflection Point: Humanoid Robots Enter Manufacturing Production

content.abstract: Physical AI reaches inflection point in 2026 as humanoid robots transition from R&D to commercial deployment. Hyundai debuts Atlas humanoid robot for production settings. Google announces major robotics investment. Applications expand in warehousing and manufacturing.

items.title: EU Bans Destruction of Unsold Clothes Under Ecodesign Regulation

content.abstract: European Commission introduces new rules prohibiting companies from destroying unsold textiles and footwear under the Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation (ESPR). Part of broader EU circular economy strategy.

items.title: Global Trade Tariffs Surge: UNCTAD Reports Protectionism Reshaping World Commerce

content.abstract: UNCTAD Global Trade Update Feb 2026 analyzes winners and losers from trade policy shifts. US tariffs make South African wine 17pp more expensive; Italian rice 12pp cheaper. Global growth subdued at 2.6%. Protectionism driven by industrial and geopolitical objectives.

items.title: NASA Perseverance Rover Makes History: First AI-Planned Mars Routes

content.abstract: NASA's Perseverance rover achieved historic milestone by driving across Mars using routes planned by artificial intelligence instead of human operators. Demonstrates autonomous navigation capability for space exploration.

items.title: UK Data Protection Overhaul: Data Use and Access Act Provisions Take Effect February 2026

content.abstract: UK GDPR updated under Data Use and Access Act: new legitimate interest criteria, revised purpose limitation, altered response periods for data subjects, enhanced data protection by design with higher standards for children.

items.title: Greenland Records Warmest January Ever: Warming 4x Faster Than Global Average

content.abstract: Greenland recorded warmest January ever: Nuuk average +0.2C vs -7.7C normal (1991-2020). Climate researchers note Greenland warming 4x faster than global average. Globally, Jan 2026 was 5th warmest on record at 1.47C above pre-industrial.

items.title: SEC Approves DTC Pilot for Tokenized Securities on Blockchain

content.abstract: SEC issues no-action letter allowing DTC to operate 3-year pilot tokenizing custodied assets on supported blockchains. Pilot launch expected H2 2026. Five national trust bank charter applications approved for crypto custody, stablecoin, and tokenization.

items.title: Amsterdam and Florence Ban Fossil Fuel and Meat Advertisements

content.abstract: Amsterdam's city council passes legally binding ban on ads for fossil fuels and meat products, becoming first capital city to fully prohibit such ads. Florence follows with similar legislation. Part of growing global movement to restrict fossil fuel advertising.

items.title: Stanford AI Predicts Disease Risk from Single Night of Sleep Data

content.abstract: Stanford researchers develop AI that predicts future disease risk from data of single night of sleep, analyzing physiological signals and finding hidden patterns across brain, heart, and breathing. Potential for early intervention and preventive medicine.

items.title: Harvard Data Breach: 115K Records Exposed via ShinyHunters Deepfake Voice Phishing

content.abstract: ShinyHunters breach exposed 115,000 records from Harvard Alumni Affairs department. Attack executed through voice-phishing using deepfake voice technology to impersonate IT support. Highlights convergence of AI and cybercrime.

items.title: Neuromorphic Computers Solve Complex Physics Equations Previously Requiring Supercomputers

content.abstract: Neuromorphic computers modeled after human brain can now solve complex equations behind physics simulations, achieving feats previously requiring energy-hungry supercomputers. Breakthrough in energy-efficient computing for scientific simulation.

items.title: US-China Competition Intensifies: Six Middle East Conflicts in Tier I/II Priority

content.abstract: CFR Conflicts to Watch 2026: Six Middle Eastern conflicts rated Tier I or II, each involving Israel. Ukraine war focuses on infrastructure attacks. US-China competition, Russian pressure on Europe, and multi-regional conflict escalation risks.

items.title: US Battery Storage to Add 20 GW in 2026; Lithium-Ion Costs Could Drop 30-56% by 2035

content.abstract: EIA projects 20 GW of utility-scale battery storage additions to US grid in 2026. Capital costs for 4-hour lithium-ion systems could fall 30-56% between 2024-2035. Clean energy investment approaching $2 trillion annually.

items.title: AI Ethics: Shannon Vallor Warns Society Underprepared for Psychological Effects of AI Interaction

content.abstract: Ethicist Shannon Vallor warns human mind is learning to interact with entities simulating understanding and emotion. Long-term consequences on mental health, social cohesion, and ethical judgment remain uncertain. Ethics treated as afterthought in AI deployment.

items.title: D-Wave Announces First Major Quantum Computing Breakthrough of 2026: Scalable Technology

content.abstract: D-Wave announces first major quantum computing breakthrough of 2026 with advances in scalable technology. Industry shifting from experimental to commercially relevant applications. Quantum-related patent filings increased fivefold from 2014-2024.
